description.narrative: Projects in developing countries, unspecified. Siemenpuu Foundation (founded in 1998) started its funding programme in year 2002 as per an agreement with the Ministry for Foreign Affairs. The Foundation funds projects of citizen's organisations and moveme nts in developing countries that are locally planned and implemented and aim at environmental protection and global dialogue. In the support emphasis are put in sustainable use and democratic governance of natural resources. In the supported projects the t hemes include environment climate empowerment of communities creation ecologically and socially sustainable practices and strengthening of civil society. Simenpuu aims to strengthen the rights of local communities to improve the state of the environment an d to advance comprehensive and ecological democratisation and transition to sustainable economy.During the funding period 2016-2018 support will be guided by thematic and regional partnerships and programmes. Funding proposals are received mainly through t hese programmes and major part of funds will be earmarked to them. Parters identified by the 15 Finnish founding organisations of the Foundation will be provided an opportunity to make proposals outside the programmes. In the beginning of 2016 there will b e some 60 projects in 18 countries. During the funding period more countries will be involved depending on the received applications.The expertise of the Foundation is based on the knowledge and networks of the founding environmental and development organi sations. They have wide range of activities in the field environmental and development policy locally in Finland and internationally. Moreover Siemenpuu has built a broad volunteer network of experts on relevant fields.
